title: Thousands in Air Force, Space Force Seek Exemption From Covid-19 Vaccines
sub_head: Facing Pentagon mandate, hundreds refuse shots; Air Force has approved 1,866 exemptions, with nearly 5,000 pending
body:
At least 7,599 airmen and members of the Space Force haven’t received a Covid-19 vaccine, either refusing to do so or seeking exemptions from military requirements, the Air Force said Wednesday, in a first set of challenges to a departmentwide mandate that troops be vaccinated to serve.
Of that number, the Air Force has approved medical or administrative exemptions for 1,866 Air Force and Space Force members, meaning they don’t have to receive a vaccine, the Air Force said.
